text: ==Events== * August - Bartolomeu Dias leaves Lisbon on his voyage to the Cape of Good Hope. ===Date unknown=== * Aztec emperor Ahuitzotl dedicates the Great Temple Pyramid of Tenochtitlan with thousands of human sacrifices. ==Births== * February 7 - Queen Dangyeong, Korean royal consort (d. 1557) * February 8 - Ulrich, Duke of Württemberg (d. 1550) * February 15 - Henry of the Palatinate, bishop of Utrecht (d. 1552) * April 10 - William I, Count of Nassau-Dillenburg (d. 1559) * July 5 - Johann Gramann, German theologian (d. 1541) * July 16 - Andrea del Sarto, Italian painter (d. 1530) * July 17 - Ismail I, Shah of Persia (d. 1524) * August 27 - Anna of Brandenburg, Duchess of Schleswig and Holstein (d. 1514) * September 10 - Pope Julius III (d. 1555) * October 5 - Ludwig of Hanau-Lichtenberg, German nobleman (d. 1553) * November 14 - John III of Pernstein, Bohemian land-owner, Governor of Moravia and Count of Kladsko (d. 1548) == Deaths == * March 21 - Nicholas of Flüe, Swiss hermit and saint (b. 1417) * June 16 - John de la Pole, 1st Earl of Lincoln (b. c. 1463) * June 26 - John Argyropoulos, philosopher * July 16 - Charlotte, Queen of Cyprus (b. 1436) * September 9 - Chenghua Emperor of China (b. 1447) * September 14 - Mara Branković, Serbian princess (b. 1416) * September 30 - John Sutton, 1st Baron Dudley, Lord Lieutenant of Ireland (b. 1400) * October 22 - Antonio Bettini, religious writer (b. 1396) * date unknown ** William FitzAlan, 16th Earl of Arundel (b. 1417) ** Tlacaelel, high priest of Tenochtitlán (b. 1397)
